does not load... 
wheel just keeps on spinning

I had the infinite spinning circle problem, too. Tried it on another computer: same thing.

Here's a workaround: before the OS starts loading (just before the VMWare logo disappears) be holding down Windows Key + V (I think any key should work, but just in case).

It will then ask you if you want to boot in verbose mode or something like that... Just type in -legacy into the prompt and it should work. It did for me. (I think this is always necessary when running VMWare on a 32-bit Windows operating system.)

If this alone doesn't work, also try putting the processor in "Binary Translation" only mode in the hardware options for the VMWare machine while the machine is off. (You still need to do the -legacy thing at boot... and it will run much slower.)

You shouldn't have to do -legacy every time. Google to find out how to make it a permanent setting. (I haven't had time, yet.)

Thanks blig! My Mac OS could load normally though very slow. After I turned on hardware virtualization in bios, it refused to load, but I used the method you mentioned to solve it. Now it runs pretty fast! (relatively speaking of course...)
I still can't get sound working though...

by the way, i think one can use
sudo nvram boot-args="-legacy"
to make it a permanent setting

nvm that. i could not change it using nvram.
i had to edit /Library/Preferences/SystemConfiguration/com.apple.Boot.plist and change

Kernel Flags


to

Kernel Flags
-legacy



...
if you are a Mac noob like me, be sure to grant write permission to yourself using Get Info to that folder and file. After saving the modification, change permissions back using Disk Utilities - First Aid - Repair Disk Permissions afterwards.
